block.powergrid.circuit_design_table.too: Writes the current design into a schematic item
Design and write _Circuit Schematics_. If you want to place components, you must have them in your inventory.
block.powergrid.potato_battery.tooltip.s: An all natural source of green energy
block.powergrid.thermometer.tooltip.beha: Measures the temperature of the device it is pointed at
Measures current and maximum temperature of the device it is placed on over time
block.powergrid.thermometer.tooltip.summ: A simple device which measures the temperature of things
death.attack.overloaded_machine.player: %s was killed by an overloaded %s whilst trying to escape %s
item.powergrid.circuit_schematic.tooltip: Sneak right-click to convert into an assembled circuit
item.powergrid.electrobaton.tooltip.beha: Attacked enemies will be _stunned_ and _no durability_ will be used. Instead, _Forge Energy_ is drained from the Battery
item.powergrid.electrobaton.tooltip.summ: Pushes back and stuns enemies (if they aren't too strong) when powered with _Forge Energy_ from a _Portable Battery_
item.powergrid.electrozapper.tooltip.beh: _No durability_ will be used. Instead, _Forge Energy_ is drained from the Battery
item.powergrid.electrozapper.tooltip.sum: Fires a lightning bolt that bounces off of nearby enemies, splitting the damage between them. Can be powered with _Forge Energy_ from a _Portable Battery_
item.powergrid.incomplete_circuit.toolti: Use _Mechanical Arms_ to insert used components and complete the circuit
item.powergrid.multimeter.tooltip.behavi: Can be used to probe voltage between terminals and current flowing through wires
item.powergrid.multimeter.tooltip.summar: A multi-purpose tool, handful to anyone who wants to play with electricity
Provides _Forge Energy_ to Equipment that requires it
Stores energy at a rate depending on the _Supplied Voltage_
powergrid.component.property.current.sum: Maximum current that this component can handle for prolonged periods of time
powergrid.component.property.label: Label
powergrid.component.property.neon_tube_i: Minimum current needed to keep the tube lit
powergrid.component.property.neon_tube_v: Voltage needed to light up the tube
Approximate voltage held by the tube once lit
powergrid.component.property.power.summa: Maximum power that this component can handle for prolonged periods of time
powergrid.component.property.regulator_t: Regulated voltage held by the regulator tube when it is lit and current is steady
powergrid.component.property.relay_thres: Voltage above which the relay triggers
powergrid.component.property.tube_anode_: Apparent anode resistance when grid voltage is zero and anode voltage is 1 V
powergrid.component.property.tube_gain.s: Controls the effect of grid voltage on anode current
powergrid.component.property.tube_heater: Power requirement for the given saturation current
Voltage required to reach the rated heater power
powergrid.component.property.tube_satura: Maximum current that can pass through the tube
powergrid.component.property.voltage.sum: Maximum voltage that this component can handle
powergrid.gui.circuit_board.damage_body: This circuit board has damaged components
powergrid.gui.circuit_designer.confirm_o: File already exists, click again to overwrite
powergrid.gui.circuit_designer.file_scro: Scroll to Select or Type in a Name
powergrid.gui.current_meter.title: Measured current
powergrid.gui.heater.title: Coil temperature
powergrid.gui.power_meter.title: Measured power
powergrid.gui.thermometer.title: Measured temperature
powergrid.gui.voltage_meter.title: Measured voltage
powergrid.message.coil_exists: This terminal already has a coil connected to it
powergrid.message.coil_max_turns: Cannot put any more turns on this transformer
powergrid.message.coil_missing_items: You don't have enough items to wind this coil
powergrid.message.coil_same_terminal: Cannot create coil connected to a single terminal
powergrid.message.connection_failed: Failed to create a new connection
powergrid.message.connection_missing_ite: You don't have enough items to make this connection
powergrid.message.connection_no_path: No valid path found to this terminal
powergrid.message.connection_too_long: This terminal is too far away
powergrid.message.connection_two_wire_ty: Cannot connect wires of different types
powergrid.message.cord_next: Connect the second end of the cord
powergrid.message.socket_taken: This socket already has a connection
powergrid.ponder.basin_heater.text_1: The Basin Heater can provide Heat to Items processed in a Basin
powergrid.ponder.basin_heater.text_2: When given enough power the heater can give the highest level of heat
powergrid.ponder.battery.text_1: The Battery allows you to store electricity for later use
powergrid.ponder.battery.text_2: As the battery discharges, its voltage and resistance will begin to change
powergrid.ponder.bell.text_1: The Alarm Bell is an electric device which makes sound when you power it.
powergrid.ponder.circuit_capacitor.text_: The capacitor is an electrical component which can store a small amount of electricity
powergrid.ponder.circuit_cgauge.text_1: The Current Gauge can be placed on a circuit board.
powergrid.ponder.circuit_cgauge.text_2: When placed on the indicated edge, it will emit a redstone signal proportional to the dial value
powergrid.ponder.circuit_electron_tube.t: The Electron Tube is a non-linear electrical component which can amplify signals
To make it work, first you need to power its heating element
It will then start conducting current from anode to cathode. This current can be controlled with the Grid pin
A negative voltage can be applied to the grid. A small change there can result in a major change of the anode current
powergrid.ponder.circuit_neon.text_1: The Neon Bulb is a simple device which will glow when you pass a current though it
powergrid.ponder.circuit_neon.text_2: It needs a current limiting resistor to not break immediately after lighting up
powergrid.ponder.circuit_potentiometer.t: The Potentiometer is a smaller version of the Rheostat
Its value can be tuned by interacting with it
The Redstone Relay can be used to switch electricity using a redstone signal
It must be placed on the arrow-indicated edge
The Regulator Tube is a special purpose device which, under correct conditions, can provide a very stable voltage reference
powergrid.ponder.circuit_relay.text_1: The Relay is a smaller version of the Contactor
powergrid.ponder.circuit_relay.text_2: When you give it the configured voltage it will switch on the normally open terminal
powergrid.ponder.circuit_resistor.text_1: Resistors are one of the simplest electrical components, they limit current going through them.
powergrid.ponder.circuit_resistor.text_2: You can calculate that current using using the V = I * R equation, where I is current, V is voltage and R is resistance
powergrid.ponder.circuit_vgauge.text_1: The Voltage Gauge can be placed on a circuit board.
powergrid.ponder.circuit_vgauge.text_2: When placed on the indicated edge, it will emit a redstone signal proportional to the dial value
powergrid.ponder.circuit_via.text_1: Copper nuggets can be used to place Vias on the circuit board
powergrid.ponder.circuit_via.text_2: They are a single pad that can be used to move traces between layers
powergrid.ponder.circuit_via.text_3: Vias can also be used to interconnect multiple circuit boards
powergrid.ponder.constant_speed_motor.te: A Constant Speed Motor combines the functionality of an Electric Motor and a Speed Controller
Its speed is constant while the provided voltage determines the stress capacity and rotation direction
powergrid.ponder.contactor.text_1: A Contactor lets you switch high currents with a lower voltage input.
powergrid.ponder.contactor_stack.text_2: And only one needs to be powered
powergrid.ponder.cord.text_1: Cords are 2 strand wires which can make connecting things easier
powergrid.ponder.cord.text_2: Cords can be attached to pairs of regular terminals at their ends
powergrid.ponder.cord.text_3: As well as most of consumer devices
powergrid.ponder.cord_junction.text_1: Cord junctions allow you to extend and split cords easily
powergrid.ponder.cord_socket.text_1: Cord sockets allow you to combine simple wires into cords with style
powergrid.ponder.current_gauge.header: Monitoring Electricity using the Current Gauge
powergrid.ponder.current_gauge.text_1: The Current Gauge displays the current flowing through it's terminals
powergrid.ponder.current_gauge.text_2: Current gauges are in series with the circuit so they can have an effect on the transferred power
powergrid.ponder.current_gauge.text_3: You can change the gauge's range by clicking on top of it
powergrid.ponder.current_gauge.text_4: When wearing Engineers' Goggles, the player can get more detailed information from the Gauge
powergrid.ponder.device_connector.text_1: Some devices don't directly expose their electrical terminals
powergrid.ponder.device_connector.text_2: To power them, you'll have to place a Device Connector and attach your wires to it
powergrid.ponder.device_connector.text_3: The Device Connector can also be used to power Forge Energy and Create: The Factory Must Grow devices (if installed)
powergrid.ponder.electric_motor.text_1: The electric motor lets you convert electricity into rotation
powergrid.ponder.electric_motor.text_2: The speed of the motor depends on the voltage you provide
powergrid.ponder.electromagnet.text_1: The Electromagnet can process items provided beneath it
powergrid.ponder.electromagnet.text_2: The Input items can be dropped or placed on a Depot under the Electromagnet
powergrid.ponder.electromagnet.text_3: When items are provided on a belt...
powergrid.ponder.electromagnet.text_4: The Electromagnet will hold and process them automatically
powergrid.ponder.fuse.text_1: A fuse can be used to protect your devices from too much current
powergrid.ponder.fuse.text_2: It will burn if the current exceeds the set value
powergrid.ponder.generator_clutch.text_1: The Generator Clutch is the base of all generator assemblies
powergrid.ponder.generator_clutch.text_2: It provides a weak coupling between your kinetic network and the generator shaft
powergrid.ponder.generator_clutch.text_3: You can use a redstone signal to change the coupling strength
powergrid.ponder.generator_housing.text_: The generator housing can be used to connect windings around a rotor
This allows for a cleaner generator setup with less wires connected around rotors
powergrid.ponder.generator_rotor.text_1: Rotors are the most basic part of a generator assembly, they generate electricity when spinning in a magnetic field.
powergrid.ponder.generator_rotor.text_2: You can extend the rotor assembly by placing more rotor blocks
powergrid.ponder.generator_shunt.text_1: The first and most common generator configuration is the shunt generator.
powergrid.ponder.generator_shunt.text_2: It is a self-excited configuration which generates a constant voltage.
powergrid.ponder.generator_shunt.text_3: When everything is wired correctly, the generator should start from the residual magnetic field of the windings
powergrid.ponder.generator_shunt.text_4: Its voltage can be tuned by changing the resistance in series with the field windings
powergrid.ponder.generator_winding.text_: Right-Clicking two shafts with a coil item will create a winding
powergrid.ponder.grounding.text_1: The grounding rod provides a 0V ground reference to your grid
powergrid.ponder.grounding.text_2: You can use it to transfer power but you must be careful...
powergrid.ponder.grounding.text_3: High potential and bad ground conditions will cause the ground to become electrified and cause damage to nearby entities.
powergrid.ponder.growth_lamp.text_1: The growth lamp is a special type of light bulb which accelerates crop growth in a certain area when powered on
powergrid.ponder.heating_coil_basic.head: Warming up the atmosphere
powergrid.ponder.heating_coil_basic.text: The heating coil can be used to heat up the passing Air Flow if enough power is applied to it
By applying a bigger voltage the Air Flow can be used for bulk blasting
powergrid.ponder.heating_coil_speed.head: Electrified bulk processing
powergrid.ponder.heating_coil_speed.text: The heating coil allows for faster bulk processing
powergrid.ponder.hv_switch.text_1: The High Voltage Switch allows you to toggle electricity using a kinetic input
powergrid.ponder.improved_grounding.head: Better ground reference
powergrid.ponder.improved_grounding.text: Regular blocks are not that conductive and will cause your grounding rod to have a high impedance
You can improve the ground conditions by adding conductive blocks close to the grounding rod
powergrid.ponder.insulated_wire.text_1: Insulated wires can be colored by right clicking them with a dye or by holding a dye in your offhand while placing them.
powergrid.ponder.light.header: Lighting up the world with electricity
powergrid.ponder.light.text_1: When light bulbs are inserted into fixtures and powered on they turn electricity into light
powergrid.ponder.light.text_2: If the voltage is not high enough, the light bulb will be dimmer
powergrid.ponder.lightning_attractor.tex: You can build a lightning attractor using lightning rods and wool placed on a Mechanical Bearing
When you spin it fast enough during a thunderstorm it will make lightning strikes more frequent
powergrid.ponder.parallel_generator_wind: Windings placed next to each other will connect in series
This allows for a cleaner generator setup with less wires connected around rotors
powergrid.ponder.power_gauge.header: Monitoring Electricity using the Power Gauge
powergrid.ponder.power_gauge.text_1: The Power Gauge can be used to measure power going into a section of the electrical network
powergrid.ponder.power_gauge.text_2: You can change the gauge's range by clicking on top of it
powergrid.ponder.power_gauge.text_3: When wearing Engineers' Goggles, the player can get more detailed information from the Gauge
powergrid.ponder.power_resistor.text_1: The Power Resistor is a simple device which lets you limit the current flow in a circuit.
powergrid.ponder.power_resistor.text_2: You can change the resistance by clicking on its top
powergrid.ponder.power_resistor.text_3: The current flow is equal to the voltage across the resistor divided by its resistance (I = V / R)
powergrid.ponder.rheostat.text_1: A rheostat can be used to vary electrical resistance using a kinetic input
powergrid.ponder.servo.text_1: A Servo can be used to precisely control mechanical movements using an electric signal
powergrid.ponder.servo.text_2: The control pin accepts a voltage between -5 and 5 volts, which maps to -360 and 360 degrees of rotation
powergrid.ponder.switch_lv_button.text_1: Switches and buttons allow you to manually toggle electricity
powergrid.ponder.switch_lv_switch.text_1: Switches and buttons allow you to manually toggle electricity
powergrid.ponder.switch_mv_switch.text_1: Switches and buttons allow you to manually toggle electricity
Components which can be placed on a circuit
powergrid.ponder.tag.electric_devices.de: Components which use electricity to do something
powergrid.ponder.tag.electric_relays.des: Components which help guide electricity in the right direction
Components which can be used to build a generator
powergrid.ponder.thunder_magnet.text_1: When lightning strikes near an iron ingot it has a chance to magnetize it
powergrid.ponder.transformer_sizes.text_: Transformers come in different sizes, each of them offering different power capabilities and winding capacities
powergrid.ponder.transformer_winding.tex: To wind a transformer, first select the starting terminal for your winding
Next, click on the transformer body and pick the number of turn you want to add
Lastly, select the end terminal for your winding
Your transformer will now transform voltage with the ratio you wound
powergrid.ponder.variac.text_1: A variac can be used to variably transform voltages using a kinetic input
powergrid.ponder.voltage_gauge.header: Monitoring Electricity using the Voltage Gauge
powergrid.ponder.voltage_gauge.text_1: The Voltage Gauge displays the voltage potential between it's terminals
powergrid.ponder.voltage_gauge.text_2: You can change the gauge's range by clicking on top of it
powergrid.ponder.voltage_gauge.text_3: When wearing Engineers' Goggles, the player can get more detailed information from the Gauge
powergrid.ponder.wire_connector.text_1: Wire connectors can be used as attachment points for wires
powergrid.ponder.wire_simple.text_1: Wires are used to transfer electricity between terminals of electric devices
powergrid.ponder.wire_voltage_drop.text_: Every wire has a resistance, the longer the wire, the more resistance it has
This causes a voltage drop to occur when current is flowing
Lost power is turned into heat
If too much power is drawn, the wires can overheat and break
